>What is Dead by Daylight?
Asymmetrical multiplayer (4vs1) horror game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to fix generators to escape the Killer and avoid being caught and killed.
http://www.deadbydaylight.com
http://deadbydaylight.gamepedia.com/Dead_by_Daylight_Wiki

>What is Soul at Stake?
Chinese Dead by Daylight but somehow worse.
http://soulatstake.com/en/index.shtml

>What is Identity V?
A new mobile game with very similar gameplay to DbD with more interesting visuals and less balance. NetEase, the team behind it, received help from Behaviour, the makers of DbD.
http://idv.163.com/

>What is Last Year: The Nightmare?
Class based with weaker killers. Intended to launch NEVER EVER.
http://www.lastyearthegame.com/the-game/
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/lastyear/last-year-5-vs-1-multiplayer-survival-horror

>Where can I get game clients?
Usually on any given servers site, but if not check here:
https://pastebin.com/Pf4934FP (embed)

>How do I connect to [server]?
1. Register on a private server that hosts the same game client you have.
2. Copy their realmlist URL. This can usually be found on the main page of the website or on their registration page.
3. Look for a realmlist.wtf file in your WoW folder. This may either be in the root folder, or inside Wow/Data/enUS/
4. Open the realmlist.wtf file in a text editor such as Notepad and paste in the realmlist settings of the server. Make sure it starts with 'set realmlist' followed by the realmlist URL.

>I have set the realmlist correctly but it still connects me to XYZ server/says invalid login info.
Make sure your realmlist is correct and not read only.

>How do I stop my client from auto-updating?
• Start the game with wow.exe - not launcher.exe
• Don't use your email for logging in, use your account name.
• Find the patchlist file in your installation and remove it.

>What the heck is this
/indie/ is the general for all indie games, such as Hollow Knight, A Hat in Time, Heat Signature, LISA, Yume Nikki, OFF, Middens, Underrail, OneShot, Age of Decadence, VA-11 HALL-A, Subnautica, FTL, Machinarium, DashBored, Dead Cells, Darkwood, Card City Nights 2, Braid, Monolith, Rain World, Axiom Verge, Guacamelee, The Desolate Hope, etc. as well as other games that just don't fit in any other general such as Atelier, Rayman, Pillars Of Eternity, Rise Of Nations, and Valkyria Chronicles. Absorbed the /lite/ general some time ago and /jrpg/ is welcome. Idle games are cool too.

Mobile or consoles, flash or unity, freeware or early access. This place is a home for the indie game community and indie and obscure games that don't have a home. So be free to talk and share all your hidden gems, forgotten games and starving devs here.

>Can I talk about games that already have a general?
We mostly discuss games that are not popular enough for their own threads, however, all indie games are allowed. So talk about them if you want, but don't overdo it since you already have other generals for that.

Dominions is a fantasy turn-based war game created by two dudes. One of them is a teacher.
The game combines a simple presentation with an extremely wide array of strategic options, including over 3000 units, 900 spells and 400 magic items. Turns are resolved simultaneously, with players planning battles rather than directly controlling them.
It has simplistic graphics but is easily moddable and extremely deep.
Basically, it's an autist’s wet dream of a war game.

>Do I need to subscribe?
It's optional, with its largest benefits being access to all DLC (but NOT Summerset), cash shop currency upon sub start/renewal, and the Craft Bag, which can save your characters a ton of bag space.

>Which faction should I choose?
If you want to PVP in Cyrodiil with friends, make sure you're in the same faction. Otherwise, it doesn't matter.

>I started with a Chapter. How do I access the original main quest?
Open your map (or visit a Wayshrine -- they're free!) and go to either Daggerfall, Vulkhel Guard, or Davon's Watch. Walk around a little. "Soul Shriven in Coldharbour" should auto-start shortly.

>And where should I begin normal questing?
Check out the original beginner stuff, first; go to Port Hunding, Khenarthi's Roost, or Bleakrock.

>The More You Know
- Level Rewards give you tons of stuff along the way, including a free mount at level 10.
- Riften is the most famous open-world RP destination. At least for PC NA.
- You need to be at least CP300 to queue for vet DLC dungeons.

Returning player here from MoP and before that TBC.

I've made around 650k in 2 days sitting at AH and not doing a whole pile. I've made more gold in WoW today than I ever have. I had 40k in MoP.

I set myself a target to make 1 million gold by the weekend, I was sitting on 300k or so today and landed a big 455k gold sale that's sent me stratospheric.

The deviation of items in the game is all over the place. I wouldn't recommend recommending a novice into learning what I do now, but definitely agree with understanding the markets. There are a ton of them. Best to understand how your own realm operates. You'll notice trends. Then eventually, without enough forethought, you'll be able to capitalise as and where needed.

I wouldn't recommend following gold guides online as they will get you absolutely nowhere. They're speaking very generally or for something that works on their own realm. As this guy states, learn the markets of your own realm.

Also, if you are gonna continue with Herbalism and mining, it's best you learn how to properly realm hop.

>>227097617
Don't listen to those brainlets. No matter the startup, once you press the DP your character is locked in animation and not going to turn around. Also, Falke's EX Psycho Schneide starts up in 12 frames and Ed's EX Psycho Upper starts up in 16, so they're not even correct about it being slower.

Normally, an auto correct DP occurs when you do the motion (or part of it) before the characters swap sides, then input the last part right after they swap. Thanks to the input buffer the special move comes out anyway.

Falke and Ed are different in that there is no beginning motion, so there is nothing to auto correct and you're simply hitting the DP before the side swap occurs. I'm gonna guess your problem stems from either timing or Falke not turning around as fast as Ed would because of different size collision boxes.
